attributes.action: Organise an international environmental conference on restoring the Aral Sea
attributes.background: I want the Government to start talks with climate and marine scientists and Heads of State to take action on Sea Level Rise (SLR).
attributes.additional_details:
This conference should explore the potential construction of a pipeline from the Black Sea to pump water to the dried up Aral Sea basin to restore the Aral Sea, which should reduce the effects of SLR.

SLR will affect countless populations causing potentially trillions of dollars of damage. Cutting greenhouse gasses will only go so far. I propose a new plan of action to slow and reduce SLR by restoring the Aral Sea! It doesn't take a genius to realize that if you take water out of the ocean that it will reduce its overall volume. Once the Aral Sea is restored it should help stabilize global weather patterns and also absorb CO2 from the atmosphere thereby slowing global warming, climate change and SLR.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Climate change to be a subject in School because it is a critical issue.
attributes.background: We only have one planet and looking at the critical nature of the environment, it is important that children from Primary Start learning about the environment at a very young age.
attributes.additional_details: We are 8 years old triplets who learned about recycling in school. We started litter picking at age 6. We volunteer at our local council and we have since inspired many children of our age. We are pleading for climate change to be a subject in school.

rejection.details:
Make ‘Environmental Education’ a compulsory separate subject in all schools.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597233

attributes.action: Ban UK government & advisors from using private jets
attributes.background: Ban UK ministers & their advisors from using private jets & ban all travel to UK government hosted events by this method of transport. Work with businesses to eliminate all private jet travel to & from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It is estimated that over 400 private jets have been used to transport delegates to COP26, this is one of the most carbon intensive forms of transport. The government intend to introduce measures that will impact the lifestyles of the population, they should take the lead by stopping this unnecessary form of transport. How will they engage people to support climate change mitigation if they don't lead by example?

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about private jet use, but we're not sure if you want the Government to stop using private jets for government business, or a much wider series of changes.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, but the scope of your request would need to be clear from the title of your petition.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of private jets to help climate change: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599977

attributes.action: Offer HVO carbon net fuel on forecourts
attributes.background: Force fuel companies to offer HVO fossil free diesel on forecourts.
attributes.additional_details:
The government are pushing climate change and this is the fastest solution to stop a huge part of it very quickly. 

For every 200L of HVO used is a saving of 850kgs of carbon saved. 
This means roads, motorways and towns would have cleaner air and our children would have better health in the future.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for retailers.

attributes.action: Aim to introduce recycling bins to all local parks across the country by 2025.
attributes.background: It was recently brought to my attention that no parks near me currently provide amenities for recycling, meaning many tonnes of waste produced at these locations each year ends up in landfill sites, furthering the ecological damage to this planet. We need to change this as soon as possible!
attributes.additional_details: There are a multitude of reasons behind this petition, but the most prominent is the immediate threat of climate change, which is becoming more and more irreversible by the second. Over 26 million tonnes of recyclable waste ends up in landfills each year from UK homes alone, which costs the government around £2,496,000,000 per year in landfill taxes. Reallocating this money and creating recycling amenities is a must if we are going to stand a chance against climate change.

attributes.action: Reduce taxes on electricity to allow heat pumps to be installed in the UK
attributes.background: Reduce taxes and "environmental levies" on electricity to encourage the UK supply chain for heat pump installations, to encourage gas fitters to retrain as heat pump engineers, to allow people to invest in clean energy.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK imposes 23% taxes on electricity, but only 2% on gas. These taxes are preventing the decarbonisation of heat in the UK. Government needs to switch taxes from electricity to gas to allow people to run heat pumps, to fight climate change, to encourage the long-term supply chain for heat pumps, reduce imports and support clean energy.
The UK cannot start to achieve 600,000 heat pump installations a year by 2028 until it reduces taxes on electricity - at least for those who install heat pumps.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about taxes on electricity and the disincentives this creates for installing heat pumps, but we're not sure exactly what taxes and levies you want to be changed, by how much, or whether you want this to apply to domestic or business electricity supplies, or both.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. If what you really want is to see increased uptake of heat pumps, it might be clearer to call for the Government to provide grants or subsidies for uptake or installation of heat pumps.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to send unsolicited marketing materials (JUNK MAIL) to UK homes
attributes.background: Such material is often just thrown away and not even read. The production and mailing of such materials has a detrimental impact on the environment and is unsolicited by the majority of households. All political parties send such materials and should lead by example whilst promoting climate change.
attributes.additional_details: Make it illegal to send unsolicited printed marketing materials (JUNK MAIL) and plastic charity collection bags to homes across the UK.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573222

attributes.action: Overfishing and dumping of fish nets is destroying the planet and this must stop
attributes.background: The government should introduce laws to limit fishing and pressure other countries to do the same. There is no accountability for the illegal overfishing. Fishing corporations are getting away with dumping nets and damaging the Ocean. New measures should be introduced to track and stop this.
attributes.additional_details: Dumping of fish nets and fishing equipment is responsible for over 50% of pollution in the ocean and politicians are protecting these corporations and enabling the destruction of Earth. Climate change will be accelerated if overfishing continues and something must be done to change this.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like to tackle overfishing, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like to do to limit fishing. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Wigan Council Review dangerous  Subsidence at Wigan Rd Park before Child is hurt
attributes.background: Call In Wigan Council to Review a dangerous piece of land on Wigan Road park Atherton that is at immediate risk of subsidence that could lead to major injury or fatality as it is a public park and well used. The slope is creeping back month on month and could collapse at any moment. This potentiall
attributes.additional_details: after months of contact with the council they have been too slow to react, it’s an accident waiting to happen potentially caused by either geographic change or climate change. Children play there constantly and will not last much longer. This is an urgent request before spring for urgent work and solution to fix permanently before someone is hurt.

rejection.details:
You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: BAN THE SALE OF REFRIGERANTS TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC:NOT QUALIFIED,  INCOMPETENT.
attributes.background:
To make it illegal for refrigerants to be sold in retail , wholesale and social media websites to non qualified and non competent personnel .



introduce a UK register of individual qualified and competent engineers that can handle these dangerous refrigerants.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice contravenes existing legislation and industry codes of practice .

Leaking refrigerants results in damage to the environment .

Non compliant people handling these dangerous refrigerants could lead to personal injury resulting in death and damage to vehicles and premises.

The U.K. Government will be supporting the RACHP INDUSTRY and DEFRA in preventing these  accidents from happening.

U.K. government will be leading on minimising   harmful climate change and environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Environment Agency has already published responsibilities for fluorinated gas wholesalers or resellers. This includes only selling to customers who hold (or who employ people who hold) the relevant certificates and qualifications. See:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/selling-f-gas-or-equipment

You can find out how to contact the Environment Agency at:
https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/environment-agency

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic or fine anyone who is found littering
attributes.background: Climate change is not only affecting England but it is affecting other countries like India,and a lot of the plastic in the rivers are because of us.Let's take action by either banning single-use plastic or fine people who litter because if we don't take action,the next generation will suffer for it

rejection.details:
We have a number of petitions open which you may wish to sign:

Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554035

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Increase penalties, enforcement and education to tackle littering & fly tipping: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

Introduce heavy fixed penalties starting at £1000 minimum for littering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334297

attributes.action: Don't turn clocks back during coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.background:
The coming winter we will spend more time indoors. We need every available hour of sunlight to be able to go outside and benefit from sunshine. Sunshine delivers vitamin D, which has been linked with reducing the effects of COVID-19.
This will also reduce energy use, helping combat Climate Change.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK Government to urgently consider the circumstances and benefits of not turning the clocks back this year, and of course going forward.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321333

attributes.action: Ban the breeding of dogs whose breed standard is so extreme it causes suffering
attributes.background: Brodies Law. Ban the breeding of dogs whose anatomy is so deformed that they suffer early death and ill health. Kennel club standards esp for brachiocephalic dogs causes immense suffering, but they will not change unless legally made to.Pls legally prevent such extreme features being bred for.
attributes.additional_details: The kennel club standards have drastically changed the anatomy of dogs. Some like the brachiocephalic dogs cannot breathe, cannot cool themselves. Suffer terribly and die. Nothing has made the kennel club change, and climate change has increased the suffering. All animals need legal protection to stop extreme features being bred for.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331084

attributes.action: Ensure companies treat Mental Health like they treat Physical Health
attributes.background: Mental Health is not given the same priority as Physical Health in the work place. Under the current climate this needs to change. Where with physical health the HSE recommend a first aid rep for companies with 5 - 50. The same recommendations need to be in place for Mental Health.
attributes.additional_details: Enforce the equalities act of 2010. Putting a duty of care on employees towards their mental health. Make it law that all companies need a mental health programme in place in the same way they implement physical health. This will help with employees mental health in the work place and impact the cost of mental illness on U.K. industry

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about employers failing to adequately meet the mental health needs of their staff, but it's not clear what action you want the Government to take in response to this.

Employers are already required to make reasonable adjustments in respect of disabled people. This covers everyone who has a physical or a mental condition which has a substantial and long-term impact on their ability to do normal day to day activities: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/advice-and-guidance/disability-discrimination

The Equality and Human Rights Commission has published advice on how employers can meet their obligations in respect of employees with mental health conditions: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/advice-and-guidance/mental-health-your-business

People who feel they have been treated unfairly and want further advice can contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service: https://www.equalityadvisoryservice.com/

We could accept a petition calling on the Government require employers to take a particular action in respect of mental health, but it would need to be clear what action you want the Government to take.

We have already published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require all workplaces to have Mental Health First Aiders: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323558

attributes.action: Ban disposable barbecues.
attributes.background:
Ban disposable barbecues from UK shops and retailers.

Disposable barbecues can be bought for as little as £1. Even children can buy them. They are widely available in shops and supermarkets. They are often bought on impulse and alongside alcohol adding to the risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Disposable barbecues cause many UK wildfires. 4 months into 2019 there were 96 wildfires burning an area equivalent to 32,140 football pitches. The worst on UK record.

Cost to health, the environment, wildlife & economy is huge

Consider Saddleworth Moor & Winter Hill Fires in 2018.

9 deaths of people already in poor health

5m people exposed to PM2.5 (particlulate matter)

£21.1m economic impact

Huge losses to habitat and wildlife

Firefighting cost £1m

Climate change is making things worse

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Use the Green New Deal to rebuild the economy after the COVID19 crisis/recession
attributes.background:
Make the Green New Deal the model to rebuild the UK economy after this crisis.
Lead the world, ahead of COP26, & use this time to create a low-carbon economy that protects against future & larger crises caused by climate breakdown.
Create millions of jobs in green sectors that lead to a 2°C world.
attributes.additional_details:
COVID19 demonstrates the fragility of society in times of crisis. Climate change, through food insecurity, water scarcity, climate refugees etc., will create similar but larger crises in the near future. 

The previous economic system guaranteed an increase in global temperatures to well above 2°C. Scientists show +2°C is the last point of safety.

COVID-19 shows we can make huge economic & social changes in times of crisis, but the bigger, climate crisis is still ahead. We must change path now.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you want the Government to use the Green New Deal as the model to rebuild the UK economy after the current crisis, but you haven't stated what the Government would need to do to achieve this.
             
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, in order to implement the Green New Deal.

You will need to include your full name if you would like to start a new petition.

Alternatively, you may wish to sign one of these petitions calling for similar actions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301709
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Allow "Personal Electric Vehicles" to use cycle lanes and roads in the UK
attributes.background: Allow the use of personal electric micro mobility vehicles on cycle lanes and roads in the uk
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is real and micro mobility will help cut co2 emissions, relieve congestion in major cities and towns and also reduce the number of road accidents from cars and other combustion engine vehicles. 1 extra person using a micro mobility device= 1 less person driving a car! 2020 needs to be the year for Zero emissions!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301014

attributes.action: Stop all new gas, oil and coal extraction
attributes.background: Stop all new gas, oil and coal extraction by banning any new mines, gas or oil fields being explored or started.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change needs drastic, fast action NOW to stop humankind killing our planet.
NO fossil fuels should be extracted from the earth any more.
Money should instead be put into renewable energy, wind, water and solar. Immediately and in large quantity to try to halt the damage we are doing to our only home and that of our children and their futures.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Extend Government funding to Transport for London (TfL) beyond 4 February
attributes.background: On behalf of my 8 yr old who wants the Government to extend its extraordinary funding to TfL beyond 4 Feb 2022 to help combat climate change and protect jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The reasons have been written by him:
 
•	Climate change: Without public transport car use will go up and London will not be able to reduce its CO2 emissions.
•	Jobs: People who can’t afford cars won’t be able to get to jobs and there will be a crisis.
•	When a train approaches a platform, I wonder how the flawless machinery works. As soon as I get on a train I feel serene. I always look out of the window while dreaming of being a train driver.
•	Lots of children will be sad if TFL shuts down. Every country wants its children to be happy.

attributes.action: UK Environmental Protection Act
attributes.background: Create & implement a UK wide environmental protection act. To preserve, restore and protect the UK and worldwide climate. Implementing rules, guidelines and sanctions for all businesses, general public, government and public services. To protect the health of individuals and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: To guide and build the public and businesses into a sustainable economy that protects and preserves the environment. It is the only way to ensure true sustainability. To make the move needed to reduce global warming and dangerous climate change that will have detrimental effects on economies, migration, crops, wildlife, disease, and many more factors. Human driven climate change is the biggest danger to our lives in the near future and change needs to happen. The UK should lead the way.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the environment, but we're not sure exactly what new laws you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

An Environment Bill, to make provision about targets, plans and policies for improving the natural environment; for statements and reports about environmental protection; for the Office for Environmental Protection; about waste and resource efficiency; about air quality; for the recall of products that fail to meet environmental standards; about water; about nature and biodiversity; for conservation covenants; about the regulation of chemicals; and for connected purposes, is already being considered by Parliament. You can find out more about this Bill here: https://bills.parliament.uk/bills/2593

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Call for an international economic conference on climate and covid crisis
attributes.background: Government to request that the UN convenes a conference of the major economies, and as many others as they can, that confronts the challenges presented by Covid and the Climate crisis, and creates a shared response, and spreads the duties and consequences of these more fairly around the world
attributes.additional_details: The Covid and climate change crisis both arise from the economic activity of humankind. The effect of Covid is that there are no economies that are safe enough to underwrite a global recovery, and there has been no recent experience of bringing about a global economic recovery on such a scale. The economic problems will fall harder on smaller economies, at a great risk of social disruption and of warfare. Provincial political responses do not deal with this, and we need a global approach.

attributes.action: Climate action now: Bring forward the Net Zero Strategy target to 2030
attributes.background: Make climate action a priority by speeding up the process of the Net Zero Strategy that sets out policies and proposals for decarbonising all sectors of the UK economy. Change the target from 2050 to 2030.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2020, the Met Office predicted the temperatures of an average UK summer in 2050. Within two years, we have already met those predictions.
Fires are now spontaneously starting in parts of England. Time is running out far quicker than expected. We urge the Government to start taking action immediately.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616392

attributes.action: Provide financial support for schools to install air conditioning in classrooms
attributes.background: Due to climate change, extreme weather events are occurring with increasing frequency. It is unreasonable to expect staff and students to work in classrooms which were not designed to withstand 35-40 degree temperatures, and school budgets are too overstretched to afford effective solutions.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing whatever possible to facilitate schools being climate resilient going into the future. Children have already missed enough learning due to the pandemic, they don’t need more missed time due to extreme classroom temperatures putting their health at risk. Closing schools is not a solution as many families are already struggling and may not have suitable cooling facilities at home either. Government must help to make schools safe environments for children.

attributes.action: Create a Task Force to support residents displaced by environmental events
attributes.background: Due to climate change, flooding and coastal soil erosion within the UK are becoming more common, in some place resulting in displacement of residents. The UK Government, therefore, needs to create a task force to mitigate the mental health impact climate change has on these people.
attributes.additional_details:
The Task Force should be given responsibility for the following:
 
- Providing access to support for mental health issues faced by displaced people.
- Providing access to economic support.
- Developing and implementing community-based solutions such as support groups and job resettlement schemes.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Temporarily ban the sale and use of disposable barbecues during lockdown
attributes.background: Countless warnings from fire services not to use disposable barbecues (and campfires) due to the risk of forest fires are being ignored. A local forest (Wareham, Dorset) has lost 220 hectares in a recent fire, taking over 150 firefighters to battle and there is an ongoing extreme fire risk.
attributes.additional_details:
As people begin to socialise with others outside but not at home, the use of these BBQs is likely to soar, posing an even greater risk to life and the environment and increasing strain on emergency services. 
Disposable barbecues are a well known danger, scorching the ground below during most uses and remaining hot for some time. Decimation of green areas by fire further accelerates climate change. This is in addition to their environmentally unfriendly single-use nature.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Limit the Impact of Climate Change with air mileage allowance
attributes.background: An air mile allowance would help to limit or reduce the effects of the climate crisis by preventing excess air travel. An annual air mileage allowance for one adult could be equivalent to 1x long haul and 1x short haul flight a year. Any unused allowance could be sold/bought on an official exchange.
attributes.additional_details:
A return flight from London to San Francisco emits more than twice the emissions produced by a family car in a year (BBC, 2020). 

As the world returns to normal following the COVID-19 pandemic, the number of flights are set to increase, especially with the effects of ‘revenge pollution’.
Without an air mile allowance, the government could impose air travel restrictions by increasing the cost of plane tickets. An air mile allowance ensures fair travel opportunities for all.

attributes.action: Mandatory carbon emissions traffic light score for all products and services
attributes.background: I want the Government to introduce a carbon emissions traffic light score for product manufacturers, service providers and utility suppliers, to make it clear to consumers (on product packaging and marketing material) what the carbon emissions are for their product or service.
attributes.additional_details:
Global governments and populations are taking notice of the fact that our planet is in danger of suffering the effects of climate change. Each year, leading nations meet to discuss how nations will move forward to help reduce emissions and mitigate the impact.
 
I believe legislation introducing new requirements for product manufacturers, utility suppliers and service providers to display a carbon emission score (whether physically, or digitally), using a traffic light system similar to that for nutritional information, could make a significant impact to driving change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Protect football clubs from flooding; act now to radically cut carbon emissions.
attributes.background: We demand the government acts fully on the recommendations of their Climate Change Commission.
attributes.additional_details:
25% of league clubs will be regularly flooded by 2050 unless we take urgent action now. 
The United Nations describe the current climate change situation as: "Code Red for Humanity" (IPCC report August 3021).
Watch this short documentary to find out more: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=NRAusanxXkg

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about climate change and the possible impact that it could have on football clubs, especially through flooding, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We are not sure if you would like to see more funding for football clubs to help them tackle climate change or if you want the Government to fully act on the recommendations of the Climate Change Commission.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We currently have the following petitions open that you may like to sign:

Change the zero carbon emission goals to 2025 instead of 2050
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594359

Fund global climate change mitigation and give displaced people refugee status
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585989

Take action to tackle global deforestation
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590280

Ban drilling for fossil fuels and put more money into using renewable energy.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/591338

Make it mandatory for companies to report all direct and indirect emissions
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594632

attributes.action: Stop Farnborough Civic Quarter development plans to cut 237 trees!
attributes.background:
We the constituents of Rushmoor District object to the unnecessary destruction of 237 mature trees which would take place if RBC's current plan for the development of Farnborough Civic Quarter goes ahead. 
This action conflicts with RBC's own Local Plan and adversely impacts the community:
attributes.additional_details:
The trees provide shade combating the urban heat-island effect.

They absorb C02 and felling them means the loss of carbon sinks combating climate change. 

Decrease in air quality close to the airport.

People living in the town centre will be affected by noise pollution.

A lack of green spaces has a negative effect on people's mental health. 

It will cause a huge loss of biodiversity and habitat for wildlife.

We are challenging this development on the grounds of RBC's own Local Plan.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local developments are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Rushmoor Borough Council also has its own petitions scheme, which you can find out about here: https://www.rushmoor.gov.uk/media/h5ioha4n/12_-_new_petitions_scheme.pdf

attributes.action: Stop the increase of cost & operational duration of the daily Congestion Charge.
attributes.background: We object to the Mayor of London’s 30% increase in cost of the daily Congestion Charge. We want determined action to improve air quality, protect people's health and tackle climate change as we emerge from the corona virus crisis, but this should be a collective responsibility, not a personal cost.
attributes.additional_details:
Forcing the general public back on to London’s already packed transport network, where social distancing is near impossible is not appropriate at this crucial time.

We invite government to review the changes to London’s Congestion Charge at this critical time.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of the London Assembly. 
You can petition the London Assembly directly: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

The Government has agreed a package consisting of a mixture of grants and loans based upon a series of conditions agreed by the mayor, including the reinstatement of the congestion charge: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-grants-transport-for-london-funding-package

You could start a petition calling on the Government to reimburse people, or particular groups of people, for the cost of the congestion charge, if that is what you want to happen. You could also start a petition calling on the Government to seek to revise the terms of its support for Transport for London, so that this is not conditional on the reinstatement of the congestion charge.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Ban unsustainable palm oil products being sold in the UK.
attributes.background: If a product contains unsustainable palm oil it shouldn’t be allowed to be imported into the UK and would be prevented from being sold in  supermarkets. We should start educating people on the harm of palm oil and the damage it is reeking across the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Palm oil had been a continual driver of deforestation, killing and heavily damaging some of the worlds most biodiverse forests. Along with this the industry is damaging the habitat of animals like the Sumatran rhino, pygmy elephant, and orangutan, all of whom are already endangered species. Climate change is being exacerbated by carbon-rich peat soils and the loss of forests, which releases millions of tonnes of greenhouse gases into the atmosphere.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Change the pricing of Renewable Energy so that it is no longer set by Gas Prices
attributes.background: The Government & Parliament should reconsider the pricing mechanism for Renewable Energy in the UK. Electricity generators usually have contracts which tie their price to the “market”, which usually is set by gas. This is horribly outdated and we need to see it changed to encourage green energy.
attributes.additional_details: We are a family of three living in South Devon. We don't want our young daughter's life to be horribly affected by climate change. We signed up to a 100% renewable electricity scheme in 2020 through Octopus Energy. We were happy to pay a premium for this renewable supply of energy over the fossil fuel rate because we believe in leading through positive action. We strongly believe that renewable energy consumers should not be punished by increasing gas prices, as has been the case for our family.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the increased cost of energy, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The energy price cap is backstop protection from the government for people who default onto their supplier's basic energy tariff. Ofgem calculates the cap level that suppliers must apply to these tariffs. The cap does not apply to customers that have chosen a standard variable green energy tariff Ofgem has exempted from the cap. For customers on a standard variable green energy tariff it is up to individual energy providers what to charge.

You can find out more about the energy price cap here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you

attributes.action: Ban the use of Private Jets in UK airspace
attributes.background: The Government must ban flights by private jets within UK airspace. Private jets are the most carbon producing means of transport and are not necessary with over 99.9% of the UK population not using them. The UK has a chance to be a world leader in this action to prevent climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost 8,000 new private jets are expected to be bought by multinational companies and the super-rich over the next decade, with the market greatly expanding.
These jets will burn 40 times as much carbon per passenger as regular commercial flights. 
There are currently no plans to restrict the use of private jets. Fossil fuel powered cars are being banned which will affect the lives and livelihoods of the majority of people whilst the elite fly overhead with no restrictions.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599977

attributes.action: Illegally ban the sale of Single use plastic bags
attributes.background: The average household uses 300 plastic bags per year. Not only do they get into our ocean and kill animals, when decaying the toxins from the bags enter out soil and land.  Reports also say they contribute to greenhouse gases from its production to its decaying.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to ban the sale of single use plastic bags and only allow the sell of reusable bags. In a time where climate change is a urgent matter this is a must in order to save species and our planet

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Ban single use plastics and the unnecessary use of plastic packaging
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

Introduce a levy on single-use disposable plastic
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554035

attributes.action: Enforce food producers to add eco ratings and eco impact data on food packaging.
attributes.background: Enforce food producers to add eco ratings and ecological impact data to food packaging. In the same format as the current traffic light system for  nutritional facts, to enable people to make a more informed choice regarding the impact the food they eat has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details: The world is facing an uncertain future and projections for climate change give us an insight into what the world will look like for our children and our children's children. We need to make changes to the way we live and the food we eat to make more eco friendly choices.  Adding an eco traffic light system to packaging, in the same way we do for nutritional facts, to highlight the carbon footprint, will help the general public make an informed decision.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: 

Require companies to display environmental rating of the products on packaging:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599438

attributes.action: End unnecessary requirement to post your driving license after paying an FPN
attributes.background: The Government should put an end to the unnecessary legal requirement to send in a driver's license after paying a fine for speeding. Doing so has been an unnecessary waste of resources since the paper counterpart was retired in 2015.
attributes.additional_details: A Private Members Bill that would have changed this law fell due to the 2017 snap general election. It would have ended the unnecessary legal requirement to send in your driving license as well as paying a fixed penalty for speeding. Currently this creates an additional cost for drivers on top of an already extortionate and unfair speeding fine campaign, as well as causing unnecessary climate damage, and wasting the valuable time and resources of the nation's police forces and courts.

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles of water
attributes.background: Ban all plastic bottled water. We can easily use tap water and save the environment. If needed, we could add water dispensers in shops so you can fill up your own bottle. Some towns and cities have already banned plastic water bottles so it is not that difficult!
attributes.additional_details: It will help climate change because the factories that make the bottles  will not be producing as much carbon dioxide and it will help plastic pollution a lot because there will not be as many plastic bottles in the seas and in our environment.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450.

attributes.action: Mandatory viewing of David Attenborough's A Life On Our Planet for all MPs in UK
attributes.background: We demand that everyone in governmental power, from all parties, watches this documentary and acts proactively towards Climate Change. We need to create systemic changes to our world, on a practical long lasting level.
attributes.additional_details: Because our future is at risk, this is an urgent issue. We want the government to care more about the environment and it's people. We want them to take action and make incentives like countries such as Costa Rica... We want them to educate themselves and care about the world we live in and the people they are creating laws for. We want them to use their power on a larger scale because we can't.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the viewing activity of individual MPs. This is a matter for each MP to decide for themselves.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554376

attributes.action: Stop the UK-USA trade deal.
attributes.background: Stop the importation of food produced to lower US welfare standards. Hormone-fed beef and chlorinated chickens should not be sold in UK grocery markets. These products’ pending accessibility will harm public health and UK farming due to competition of low prices.
attributes.additional_details: Consuming hormone-fed foods increases the risk of health issues, hormonal imbalance and cancer. These items are marketed at a cheap price and this targets lower socioeconomic groups and contributes to the vulnerabilities of health in low-income households. These products threaten business for British small and sustainable farms. This method of farming causes cows, chickens and pigs to grow unnaturally fast to speed production, threatening animal welfare and climate change.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

Disallow Food that is Lower than the Minimum UK Production & Welfare Standards: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326837

Legislate in the Agriculture Bill to protect the UK’s Food & Farming Sector: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321419

attributes.action: Procurement Bill enshrines climate change considerations for all public spend
attributes.background: Procurement Bill 2022 is at the committee stage in the House of Lords. This provides Government and Parliament an opportunity to incorporate specific environmental considerations and obligations on all Contracting Authorities in relation to the management of procurement and public expenditure.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is an existential threat to the UK and globally. UK Public Sector spends £300B per annum, tax payers money should be spent to prevent negative climate impact and encourage positive climate solutions and innovation. This supports Governments stated strategy of being a world leader in climate change, its COP26 and broader climate obligations, while encouraging economic growth. Current policies have proven to be insufficient to drive the change required, hence legislation is needed.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understanding you'd like changes to the Procurement Bill in relation to climate change, but we're not clear from your petition how you'd like the Bill to be amended. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: A Public Electric Vehicle Charger which does not work must pay a daily charge.
attributes.background: The biggest problem with the charging network is that a significant number of chargers are out of service for weeks and months. The government provides a financial incentive to install chargers, I want the government to incentivise companies to make their chargers available instead.
attributes.additional_details: Changing the country from fossil fuel to electric vehicles is essential if we are to honour our climate change commitments. One of the major problems stopping people buying electric cars is the difficulty in charging them during journeys (longer than 100/150 miles). The problem is getting worse as more cars are electric, but the biggest problem of all is that many installed chargers don't work. Only government is in a position to do something about this.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the availability of electric vehicle chargers, but we're not sure if you want the Government to introduce fines for chargers that are out of service, or to replace existing grants for charging infrastructure with fines.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Increase all fossil fuel price by 2% every month until 2050.
attributes.background: The UK Government must collect an increasingly higher duty on all types of fossil fuel used for all private and business uses. These extra funds must be aimed at fast-tracking sustainable and affordable green energy and support a generational transition to sustainable business practices.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change requires a drastic change in everyone's lifestyle. Fossil fuel is the main cause of it, and we need to stop using it now. Churchill famously said 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat', and without a rapid change of course we will soon face food and water scarcity and a breakdown of society as we know it. Collecting more duty from all fossil fuels will force consumers and businesses to change habits and fund a fundamental shift across the entire nation.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

The Government is responsible for setting duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, but decisions about prices for these products are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling for changes to duties on fuel and other fossil fuel products, if that's what you want to happen.

attributes.action: We are want the UK government to support legislation for climate refugees.
attributes.background: Globally, there is no officially recognised definition and/or legal protection for climate refugees. This is a global problem and the UK is no exception. We want the UK government to develop and deliver climate-policy for the protection of environmental migrants and climate refugees.
attributes.additional_details: According to the UN Human Rights Council, there are currently as many as 70.8 million forcibly displaced people globally. But, despite growing levels of forcible displacement and environmental migration, climate refugees do not receive any legal protection.  This is not a 'faraway' problem and we will increasingly see displacement both within the UK and displacement to the UK. Climate change is a human rights issue and the UK government must recognise this to achieve equitable futures for all.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We understand you want legislation relating to climate migrants, but we're not sure what you'd like that legislation to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Don't sell out COP26 by lettings companies like NatWest sponsor it
attributes.background: If the government is serious about making changes to society to save the environment they shouldn't allow companies like NatWest, who invest in fossil fuels, clean up their image and sponsor COP26 without a complete commitment to the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
NatWest score 0/20 on www.ethicalconsumer.org on the environment. This is because they fund fossil fuels. Even their own attempt to look green says they will:
"At least halve the climate impact of our financing activity by 2030 and intend to do what is necessary to achieve alignment with the 2015 Paris agreement."

Which means a bare minimum of change not a complete commitment to change. It means they will continue to fund companies that are contributing to climate change for a further 9 years.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about sponsorship of COP26, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do.

Your petition says the Government should not allow companies to sponsor COP26 without "a complete commitment to the environment", but it's not clear what this would mean in practice.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to end sponsorship deals with companies that do not meet certain requirements, but it would need to be clear what you wanted these requirements to be.

attributes.action: Make David Attenborough a Lord
attributes.background: Recommend to H. M. the Queen that David Attenborough be created a Lord because of his lifelong service to nature and education.
attributes.additional_details: David Attenborough has been a constant for generations, educating young and old about the natural world and most recently about the dangers and effects of climate change. He has done more than any other person in the world to bring the wonders of nature into our homes via the medium of television. His spectacular programmes are always complemented by his own unique, beautiful narration. His service to the education of the UK, and wider world, deserves the highest recognition.

attributes.action: Stop work on HS2 immediately and hold a new vote to repeal the legislation
attributes.background: We ask Parliament to repeal the High Speed Rail Bills, 2016 and 2019, as MPs voted on misleading environmental, financial and timetable information provided by the Dept. of Transport and HS2 Ltd. It fails to address the conditions of the Paris Accord as costs have risen from £56bn to over £100bn.
attributes.additional_details: Our environment and economy are in peril. HS2 is destroying nature and inflicting suffering on businesses and property owners. Government is investing in an inept and recklessly run project, offering poor value for money. HS2 will not reach Net Zero by 2050 nor help us level up the North. The pandemic has changed how we work forever and invalidated the business case. Given the climate emergencies we face, and now the economic and pandemic crises - Parliament must vote to repeal the legislation.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/314520

attributes.action: Take action now to reduce UK emissions by 50% by 2030 to avoid climate disaster
attributes.background: The UN is warning that unless emissions are cut in half by 2030 there will be a climate catastrophe. Follow UK Committee on Climate Change recommendations. Do not grant new fossil fuel licenses, invest in green technology including energy storage and reintroduce green incentives.
attributes.additional_details: I cannot sit idly by and watch the lack of focus on climate issues. There are daily reminders of the issues climate change is already causing and we are perilously close to some critical tipping points. I want my daughter to have a future. One where we are working to restore the world and not to continue with a growth at any cost mentality.

rejection.details:
The Government is already working towards its commitment to reduce emissions in 2030 by at least 68% compared to 1990 levels.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

End All Government Subsidies for Fossil Fuel Companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621583

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

attributes.action: Spend a day without using fossil fuels to prevent climate change
attributes.background: To stop fossil fuel usage in the UK for 1 day every 2 weeks. Fossil fuels are one of the major things contributing to climate change, using these produce greenhouse gases, methane, carbon dioxide and water vapour, increasing their amounts in the atmosphere, making it harder for heat energy to leave.
attributes.additional_details: To help stop climate change and reduce the amount of fossil fuels we release into the atmosphere. To save our planet, including all the animals and nature which are struggling to survive because of humanity. We can do this by walking, or bike-riding to places instead of driving, using less energy at home, eating more plant based products, throwing away less food, stopping factory productions that produce greenhouse gases, forcing them to go green and recycling, reusing and repairing more often.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the use of fossil fuels, but it's not clear exactly what action you want the Government to take. It's not clear if you want the Government to ban the use of all fossil fuels, and fossil fuel-derived products, for one day a fortnight, or do something different.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Give the right for leasehold flats to install air conditioning units
attributes.background: Currently laws prohibit owners of leasehold properties to make structural changes. Whilst this is understood, there is a growing need for flats to remain cool in soaring temperatures. Therefore this rule should be relaxed to allow appeals by leaseholders, with only extenuating refusals
attributes.additional_details: The recent record-breaking sweltering temperatures - alongside the worry about these becoming more commonplace with climate change - has meant that working-from-home requirements can often lead to an increase in health conditions, for both residents and pets. Therefore rules should be relaxed to allow for installation of air conditioning units on existing blocks by leaseholders, with new developments providing the options to install to purchasers.

rejection.details:
The installation of air conditioning in leasehold properties is a decision to made between the freeholder and the leaseholder, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament. Each leasehold agreement is different depending on what has been negotiated with the freeholder. 

You can read more about leaseholder rights and responsibilities here: https://www.gov.uk/leasehold-property/leaseholder-rights-and-responsibilities

attributes.action: Hold a general election in the spring of 2023.
attributes.background: The new PM will have had months in post by the end of 2022 so the public will be aware of their policies and direction. All parties would have time to prepare for an election. An election would reinvigorate political parties & force them to come up with policies that help the country collectively.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit hasn't been done and many of the manifesto policies have been scrapped or changed. We are plodding along in a climate emergency, yet the govt have very few policy ideas to alleviate the impact, let alone stick to their climate commitments. There are strikes, crises in almost every department from NHS & social care to the DWP. A general election would force a rethink and hopefully introduce fresh policies and renewed energy for the things people need.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611905
